snippet: What began as a public relations predicament for American technology companies has evolved into a moral crisis that threatens the foundation of their businesses.
abstract: America's technology companies, angered by reports of how far government has gone in spying on Internet users, are pushing back in various ways, including building technical fortresses to make sure private information is inaccessible; measures are seen as attempt to cope with moral and business crisis that threatens foundation of their companies, which rests on consumers and companies trusting them with their digital lives.
lead_paragraph: What began as a public relations predicament for American technology companies has evolved into a moral crisis that threatens the foundation of their businesses.

headline.main: Angry Over U.S. Surveillance, Tech Giants Bolster Defenses
headline.print_headline: Angry Over U.S. Surveillance, Tech Giants Bolster Defenses
